main_definition: A unit of quantity equal to one thousand items or units.

meanings_and_examples.example: There were a thousand reasons why I decided to attend the event.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used as an adverb or adjective meaning 'very' or 'extremely'.
meanings_and_examples.example: It was a thousand times better than last year's celebration!

meanings_and_examples.definition: In sports and games, used to denote one of the highest levels of achievement.
meanings_and_examples.example: She won three thousands in golf.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Refers to a large but not exact quantity or amount.
meanings_and_examples.example: I have around a thousand dollars saved up for my trip.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used as an idiomatic expression, meaning 'a great many' or 'a lot'.
meanings_and_examples.example: The teacher gave out ten thousand pieces of candy on Halloween.
